Text: Today isn't your day, is it?
Point me to the alderman's house.
It's down the alley to the left.
We don't want your kind here, Witcher.
The alderman, tell me where he is and I'll be on my way.
You don't give the orders around here...
[scoffs] you mutant son of a bitch.
Go on your own or at the end of a rope, your choice.
Yeah, fuck that. Kill him with your bare hands if you have to.
C'mon, Witcher. You're not scared of us, are ya? Show us what you've got.
Can you not leave it alone for a moment?
I apologize for my man's interference in your day. Hopefully he can improve his behavior by tomorrow's market.
Beer for my friend here and one for me. I am speaking to you now, good sir.
My mother, God rest her, would be mortified.
So, what brings you to Blaviken, White Hair? You came for a monster?
I was traveling by the swamp.
That would be your mistake, then. Why wouldn't you travel by main roads?
It's hard to make a living on main roads.
And you desperately need money for new clothes.
More and more, I find monsters wherever I go.
How much coin for your kikimora, then?
I killed a rat this morning with my breakfast fork.
Stabbed it in its fat little gut.
My mother nearly fainted, but what was I supposed to do?
It had been shitting in our pantry for days.
Isadora said you were looking for my father.
Probably went two steps into the Lord's Inn
before she was running off telling everyone an evil witcher had arrived.
And I can also tell you that my father will have no usefor this beast.
You should speak to Master Irion, our wizard.
He's willing to pay for odds and ends he needs for elixirs.
I sold him our dog when it died. Mysteriously.
I got 15 crowns for the yappy mutt.
That's enough to buy some new clothes. Just saying.
[girl] Have you ever killed a succubus? A striga? Werewolf? She-wolf?
I think that makes you a hero. My mother says ou're the offspring of foul sorcery, a diabolic creation, a filthy degenerate born of Hell.
Have you ever been to Hell?
Because my mother's never left Blaviken,
and if it's good enough for Libushe, then it's good enough for Marilka.
I don't know where that is, but I could learn, if you'd let me.
Because I'm a girl and girls can't be witchers.
Which I think is probably the stupidest thing I've ever heard.
because I don't know what to do in Blaviken for the rest of my life,
except go to the boring old market.
I have a kikimora for Master Irion.
Irion created this tower, but he's been dead 200 years.
So, in order to honor him, I've taken his name as my...
No, this is, uh... this is...
Not often do we see your likeness here in Blaviken.
Not many of my likeness left.
I'd offer you my condolences, but...
I seem to remember that witchers don't feel...
I'm grateful destiny brought you to me.
Oh, Marilka. Marilka works for me.
A reclusive sorcerer who uses an alias
and hires a young girl to procure him a witcher.
You want me to kill yours.
There's no way you can get five.
You're not taking a bite of that bread before I try.
I didn't steal the bread. Korin did!
You need to come with us.
[woman] As your Queen, I grant you this commendation,
which will symbolize your duty and bond as liegemen
in fealty to the crown of Cintra.
Could use with a bit of feel-ty myself right now.
[Queen] Do you promise to defend to your utmost the weak, the orphaned...
Late wee pups don't get to bark.
I was playing in the square.
Did you win this time? Like I showed you.
if the horsemen of doom hadn't ridden up like that.
If you can't win a game of knucklebones
for fear of a few horses...
...what'll you do when you go into battle?
...in fealty to the crown of Cintra.
[sighs]  At least you didn't shit your kecks.
As members of the Royal Family,
is it too much to ask that you exercise a modicum of respect?
This is your duty as king and grandfather.
Grant me leave, my Queen. I am worn from my trip to the Isles.
And my bedchamber duties before that.
which will symbolize your duty and bond...
Mine, for example, is beautiful on the outside, but...
She has stretched her bloody talons towards me.
You talk nonsense while making wise and meaningful faces.
Have you ever heard of the...
It marked the imminent return of Lilit,
demon goddess of the night sent to exterminate the human race.
According to the wise mage Eltibald,
Lilit's path was to be prepared by 60 women wearing gold crowns
who'd fill the river valleys with blood.
I studied the girls born around the Black Sun,
and I found horrendous internal mutations among them.
locked them in towers for safekeeping,
They were autopsied, of course, to confirm my suspicions.
But eliminating these women was the lesser evil.
They could've drowned entire kingdoms in blood.
If you'd been alive during Falka's Rebellion, seen what I saw--
But not Renfri, the beautiful one.
Daughter of King Fredefalk of Creyden.
I delivered the princess myself in the middle of the afternoon
Under the Black Sun, so... she's cursed.
Do you consider me a fool, Witcher?
Do you think I did not conduct research? Renfri was acutely affected.
Her stepmother, Aridea, told me she tortured a canary,
even gouged out her maid's eye with a comb.
I admit what happened next was not ideal, but...
with the lives of Aridea's own children on the line, we had to act.
So I dispatched someone to follow Renfri into the woods.
We found him in the brush,
Renfri's antique brooch jammed into his ear.
After that, I organized a manhunt to find the princess, but... eh...
robbing and murdering merchants on the roads of Mahakam.
Impaled them on sticks at first, but soon,
And now no man can defy her, it's said.
You're not a man. You're a magician.
She's chased me for years, bent on revenge.
And now she's tracked me here, just as you arrived.
The kikimora kills because it's hungry, Renfri kills for pleasure.
She is a monster. She is the last of Lilit's women.
And she possesses the power to destroy us all.
I don't believe anyone has that power.
With the fate of the Continent at stake, is that a chance you're willing to take?
I haven't only done good in my life either.
if I have to choose between one evil and another,
then I prefer not to choose at all.
These shindigs need a touch of the old abracadabra.
He means to pull a disappearing act. don't you?
I saw the Wraiths of Morhogg over the channel this morning.
No good will come of it.
The North has been at war since Nilfgaard took Ebbing.
If legend is true, the Wild Hunt's years behind the curve.
The Nilfgaardian force crossed the Amell Pass.
Headed to Sodden, if they're smart.
And if not, 50 of your Skelligen ships are on the way.
We have more knights. We are prepared in case--
Nothing for you to be concerned about.
Your dismissive tone says it is.
Should we fall to Nilfgaard, your granddaughter will rule.
She needs to understand the way of things.
We will not fall, because we are not under attack!
You won your first battle in Hochebuz when you were my age.
Three thousand of my men died.
If we must do this now,
As in life, it is impossible always to be fully prepared for battle.
Thank you for allowing our company at this splendid affair.
Would you honor me with a dance?
Reminds me of your daughter's betrothal feast.
The night you finally saw sense, said yes.
Made me the happiest man on the Continent.
I did it to save my kingdom.
you may not leave this shindig.
[whispers] Your Majesty, my scouts have returned.
Nilfgaard is on its way to Cintra.
[Queen] Let her enjoy this night in peace.
It may be her last for a while.
she took you to see Stregobor, didn't she?
I know who you are, Renfri.
You know that I want to kill Stregobor, then.
I used to be a princess. Did he tell you that?
Until he sent a thug into the woods to kill me.
robbed me and let me go.
I killed rather than be killed.
Nohorn and the others saved me.
And they'll be by my side at the market as I get my revenge.
Lilit help me, I will take down anyone in my way.
You want me to kill Stregobor for you.
Stregobor asked you to kill me too.
'Cause I was a girl born during an eclipse?
I could've become so many things.
she just won her first battle at Hochebuz.
But here I am trying to convince you I'm not--
When I cut my finger, I bleed. That's human, right?
When I overeat, my stomach aches.
When I'm upset, I swear. And when I hate someone...
for stealing my whole life from me, I kill him.
People call you a monster too.
What if they come after you?
I am what they say I am.
that I can neither forgive Stregobor nor renounce my revenge,
Not fair that I'm trapped here.
I could magically put you to sleep, Princess.
For you and everyone else in the castle.
The King and Queen ordered us to remain here,
and that's what we shall do.
And why are you not there?
My duty is to protect you.
It's the greatest honor of my life.
sorcerers were known to lock little girls in towers.
You know cautionary tales don't work on me.
The girls were said to be cursed.
They were said to announce the end of the human race.
Will my grandmother be all right?
You will be all right, Princess.
And the apple never falls far from the tree.
There's been a storm, Your Majesty.
Then we fight alone. We cannot surrender Cintra!
[woman] Guide us to the safety of your arms, hold us in your light,
protect us from the imperial darkness that threatens our souls.
[Martin] Are we going to be okay?
[woman] Don't worry, Martin. The Queen will defeat Nilfgaard.
[man] ...won't stop until they get what they want!
[Calanthe] ...a hundred arrows on my body first! [sobbing]
Nilfgaard have made their way into the city.
how many of them are safe within our walls?
A hundred or so, Your Majesty. The guests from the banquet.
I haven't. Ask Mousesack. I've been impatient.
You will rule this land someday.
Why are you saying all this?
when I go, it will be far more dramatic than this.
[Geralt] You know what Vesemir would say.
We shouldn't try and uphold the law.
We get paid in coin. And he's right."
Want to hear about my first monster?
Wasn't 50 miles outside of Kaer Morhen.
He pulled that girl from the cart,
tore her dress off in front of her father and said,
It's time you met a real man."
I told him it was time he met one too.
It took two strikes to kill him.
I turned to that girl afterwards.
She was drenched in the man's blood.
She took one look at me,
I thought the world needed me too.
You gave me an ultimatum and I find they work.
My men, they love me and I love them.
But it's been a long time since someone saw me.
my mother used to run her fingers...
to know the thoughts going around in there.
Your Majesty, the Nilfgaardians will breach the castle gates.
My powers could not hold them any longer, Your Majesty.
Now what? What do we do?
Destiny may yet side with us.
Know when it's time to stop moving.
Which means that right now, my citizens are being tortured.
Their insides are being pulled to their outsides while they watch.
Their tongues fed to the dogs.
In the face of the inevitable, Cirilla,
good leaders should always choose mercy.
In the future, you will be wise to do the same.
Continue to be brave. Promise me.
You are the Lion Cub of Cintra.
You are destined for great things.
I can't do this without you.
has been an honor to us all.
I'm sorry to disturb, my lady. It is time.
We can find a way out.
Princess, I gave your grandmother my word.
My grandmother said I had to leave.
Why does the world depend on it?
[Lazlo] We're getting close to the gate.
I've been protected my whole life, Lazlo.
[Renfri] You were in the market. Covered in blood.
[echoing] You say you can't choose, but you had to.
And you'll never know if you were right.
Your reward will be a stoning.
You will try to outrun the girl in the woods, but you cannot.
She's at the tower with your little friend,
She gave us a message to pass on to you.
You have to choose the lesser evil.
I will kill everyone here until Stregobor comes down.
I won't be able to stop.
They created me just as they created you.
The girl in the woods will be with you always.
Get-- get back here, you little--
We'll take her to the tower for an autopsy.
If you touch a single hair on her head...
yours will be on the ground next.
That's how she got these men to follow her.
She got to you too, didn't she?
You butchered bodies in the streets of Blaviken.
You took the law into your own hands.
And you'll never know if it was the right one.
[Renfri] The girl in the woods will be with you always.
